biz.aduna.map.cluster
Interface ClusterMapMediator

public interface ClusterMapMediator

A ClusterMapMediator is a building block for constructing a GUI around a ClusterMap. The purpose of a ClusterMapMediator is to create a collection of GUI components that allow the user to view and adapt the contents of a ClusterMap, and to keep those components synchronized, while not restricting the way they will be combined in the overall GUI. Also, the ClusterMapMediator allows to set and retrieve Actions, allowing implementors to define their own menus and (toolbar) buttons.

A complete, ready-to-go ClusterMapGUI is also available, offering a default combination of components.

One of the conceptual differences between a ClusterMap and a ClusterMapMediator is that the ClusterMapMediator operates on a Classification tree rather than a ClusterModel. From this Classification tree a ClusterModel is derived during user interaction, which is then set on the ClusterMap. Furthermore, the methods to visualize or select objects return immediately; the requests are queued and evaluated in a separate thread.

A ClusterMapMediator is typically produced by a ClusterMapFactory.

A ClusterMapMediator can be configured through a key-value-based mechanism. See the ClusterMapUIConstants interface for a list of keys and some symbolic values. Their use is described in the documentation provided with the Cluster Map library.

Changes to the ClusterMapMediator can be observed through the ClusterMapMediatorListener interface.

Subsequent invocations of the same component-returning method will return the same component.

See Also:
ClusterMap, ClusterMapFactory, ClusterMapUIConstants, ClusterMapGUI

Method Detail

getClusterMap

public ClusterMap getClusterMap()
Returns the ClusterMap controlled by this ClusterMapMediator.

setClassificationTree

public void setClassificationTree(Classification classTree)
Sets the Classification tree to be explored in the components under the control of this ClusterMapMediator. This may be 'null', in which case the components will be emptied.

Parameters:
classTree - The root of the Classification tree.

getClassificationTree

public Classification getClassificationTree()
Returns the Classification tree that is explored using this ClusterMapMediator.

loadClassificationTree

public void loadClassificationTree(java.io.File file)
Loads and sets the Classification tree that is serialized in the specified File. Any errors during this operation are notified to the user via some kind of dialog (how this is done is entirely up to the implementing class to decide).

loadClassificationTree

public void loadClassificationTree(java.io.InputStream stream)
Loads and sets the Classification tree that can be read from the specified InputStream. Any errors during this operation are notified to the user via some kind of dialog (how this is done is entirely up to the implementing class to decide).

visualize

public void visualize(java.util.List classifications)
Requests that the specified list of Classifications is visualised. Rather than setting this ClusterModel directly on the ClusterMap, instead of directly setting a ClusterModel on the ClusterMap, this method will queue the request instead, as well as update the graph history, obey the "auto update" setting, etc.

visualize

public void visualize(ClusterModel model)
Requests that the specified ClusterModel is visualized. This variation of the visualize method allows you to filter a generated ClusterModel before visualization, so that e.g. only the most relevant Clusters are shown. This request for visualization is queued: the method returns immediately but the visualization may be updated later. In contrast to the visualize(List) method, this visualisation request is not added to the graph history, since the history manager does not store the entire ClusterModel and thus cannot reconstruct it later on.

select

public void select(java.util.Collection objects)
Requests that the specified set of objects are selected. These can be Classifications, Clusters or Objects contained in Classifications or Clusters. This overrules any previous select requests that are still pending in the queue.

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.Object subject,
                        java.lang.Object value)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the property indicated by the specified key and optionally the specified subject to the specified value. The possible keys and some symbolic values are defined in ClusterMapUIConstants.

The specified settings will be parsed immediately but will only become effective when the applyProperties method is invoked. This strategy allows efficient updates of several properties at once.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the specified key or subject is unknown or when the specified value is illegal.
See Also:
ClusterMapUIConstants

getProperty

                                    java.lang.Object subject)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the value of the property indicated by the specified key and optionally the specified subject.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case of unknown keys or subjects.

                                           java.lang.Object subject)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the default value of the property indicated by the specified key and optionally the specified subject.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case of unknown keys or subjects.

applyProperties

public void applyProperties()
Applies the properties that have been set on this ClusterMapMediator since the last invocation of this method.

addClusterMapMediatorListener

public void addClusterMapMediatorListener(ClusterMapMediatorListener listener)
Add a ClusterMapMediatorListener to this ClusterMapMediator, which is notified about changes to this ClusterMapMediator.

removeClusterMapMediatorListener

public void removeClusterMapMediatorListener(ClusterMapMediatorListener listener)
Remove a ClusterMapMediatorListener from this ClusterMapMediator. Nothing changes when the listener is not registered.

getAction

public javax.swing.Action getAction(java.lang.String key)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the Action indicated by the specified key. See the documentation provided with the Cluster Map library for information on which Actions are available and under which key.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case of an unknown key.

getGraphPanel

public ClusterGraphPanel getGraphPanel()
Returns a ClusterGraphPanel showing the current contents of the ClusterMap. ClusterGraphPanels only operate correctly when put in a JScrollPane.

getClassSelectionTree

public javax.swing.JTree getClassSelectionTree()
Returns a tree that lets the user determine the set of Classifications to be visualised in the ClusterMap. The resulting JTree only operates correctly when put in a JScrollPane.

getGraphScaler

public javax.swing.JComponent getGraphScaler()
Returns a component that allows the user to select the scale at which the graph will be displayed.

getToolBar

public javax.swing.JToolBar getToolBar()
Returns a JToolBar component containing buttons representing the most commonly used Actions and similar control objects. The tool bar is created lazily, as it contains the graph scaler, which then cannot be used elsewhere anymore.

getMenuBar

public javax.swing.JMenuBar getMenuBar()
Returns a JMenuBar containing the most commonly used Actions. The menu bar is created lazily.
